A decent, arcadey horde shooter reminiscent of games like Left 4 Dead, only in an arena rather than being linear. However, be warned. The Linux port is awful. It rarely runs well, and takes a long time to start up. I would advise playing on Windows or not at all.

Killing floor is one of them games with an easy perk system .. You get to perk 6 and that's it folks there's absolutely no replay value at all. I got to perk 2 and gave up since there's no motivation to get to perk 6 and you'll find that 60% of the ''veterans'' will be in your games with perk 6. I always ask myself why the hell would they bother since they are max rank and then it occured to me they are showing off. Do not buy this game if you want replay value it is repetitive and boring. Buy Borderlands 2 or something instead this game should be free not 20$ it's a rip off.

С Детства являюсь ярым фанатом игрушки Unreal и Unreal Tournament. Сыгранно было не мало часов, но вскоре unreal 2004  надоел своим однообразием, и я стал искать модификации. Нашел модификацию Killing floor в виде мутатора.
( А ведь именно  так все и началось для killing floor,  и уже тогда этот мод обрел популярность среди игроков ).
Мутатор представлял из себя полное изменение геймплея - бои шли уше не от первого лица, а от вида сверху. Появился хардкор, динамика, и, соответственно, интерес... 
Unreal с данным модом смогли затянуть меня еще на пару часиков.... Мод дико понравился, но опять же - чего-то не хватало. 

И вот, спустя пару лет узнаю от подруги про самостоятельный проект, под тем же самым названием - Killing floor.
Только зайдя в меню и узнав в нем  Unreal, я был приятно удивлен - игра получила тот же самый, мой любимый движок UE 2.5, и с каждой секундой кф нравилась мне все больше. И так, игра затянула меня 2 года назад, я играл часами на пролет и продолжаю играть  по сей день :3

А теперь перейдем к  плюсам и особенностям:

1: Множество различных карт, на которых можно побегать не только одному, но и с компанией  до 6 человек на карте

2: Огромнейший выбор оружия, как и огнестрельного, так и холодного

3: Интереснейшая особенность - прокачка *перков* (Англ. Perks) до 6 уровня, дающая как преимущество в бою, так и различные  бонусы к оружию ( Увеличение патронов, снижение отдачи, скорость перезарядки и тд. )

4: Главная фишка, которая была и у Unreal - самому менять геймплей как вздумается, с помошью *Мутаторов*, Внося тем самым как и мелкие изменения в геймплее, так и полностю поменять его и настроив под себя

5: Слоу-мо :D

This is the most repugnant game Ive ever played. If you feel like spewing a vomit-rocket at your monitor every time you see an infected, this game is for you. Your character feels like it's fundamentally glued to the ground. Character models are from an early 2000s MMORPG. Environments are grainy, maze-like, and absolutely disgusting. The sounds are equally gross and obnoxious. 

The game is abhorrent, sick, and somewhat demented. 

I used to play it a lot but couldn't take much more of it after a while. Enter at your own risk.
10/10 would slomo again

Ex-soldier-turned DJ, Scully's still haunted by the grisly memory of a pounding nightclub transformed into bloody abattoir at the hands of Horzine's monstrosities. Once reluctant hero, now avenging angel, Scully seeks new and steam-powered ways to stick it to the creatures who robbed him of his first ever flawless DJ set. Now Scully destroys evil wherever he finds it, hoping that one day the world will return to normal and that he'll finally get to play the perfect 'killer' set without everyone being gruesomely murdered.

Short and sharp, wave survival based teamplay FPS. Frantic zombie splattering goodness!

- too cheap visual, motion, voice, and system. like a game made by high school students.
- black b1tch forces us every after wave to run around just for shopping.
- though that, this b1tch is so ugly.
- and sometimes rookies are killed by her for unable to unite with seniors.
- of course, these seniors who dont wait others, are scum.

- every enemy can smell us where we are, so we can never hide for recovery.
- xbow is more strong than bullet.
- tall pig filled with puke, can not be blasted even if by a grenade.
- insane quota for level-up, like a korean mmo rpg.
- too fast boss, never give us even a break if once sticked on,
   until u give him about 1/2-1/3 damage of entire health.

- too many idiot players who must camp in same place even if its so far from shop.
- because of that, player who was left behind, must struggle with enemies scums left too.

only if u can forgive these faults and have good friends who never left u behind,
may can enjoy sometimes. if not, i never recommend, it will waste your time and make u mad.
grate game good fun with a group ..not much to dis-like other then the 21 dam dlcs hopeing killing floor2 will be more the same but less fu-cking dlc bullsh-it

Great game!

Runs on the shittiest of systems I have a windows 7 laptop that is pretty low key and It runs absolutely perfectly at a constant 60fps. Only seen a few little glitches so far and the gameplay is superb. Wat's more this game is in the sale right now and I got it for £3.00 or thereabouts. I'd get it quickly as it is one of the best deals you're likely to see for a long time.

This is one of those rare games that still either scares you, or surprises you even after playing for hours and hours. I still panic like a mofo when I turn down a corridor or around a corner, and there's a Fleshpound just chillin' heading my way. Good times. :']
Jeux tres sympathique entre amis
Ein Geiles Zombie-Shooter Game

I've played a lot of FPS games, from story-driven single player ones to full-on epic multiplayer ones, and this game is one of the rare ones which I would come back to play again and again, for the kick if nothing else. Albeit being released in 2009, it still feels satisfying whenever a bunch of guys manage to kill the Patriarch on the hardest difficulties (and it's not even that easy either), not to mention the 'force' of the gun recoils with every shot (more apparent on single shot guns). I can't wait for Killing Floor 2 now.
